columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time when the event was recorded

columns.name: DataSource
columns.description: Data source for the cloud audit events, can be GCP (for Google Cloud Platform), AWS (for Amazon Web Services), Azure (for Azure Resource Manager), Kubernetes Audit (for Kubernetes), or other cloud platforms

columns.name: ActionType
columns.description: Type of activity that triggered the event, can be: Unknown, Create, Read, Update, Delete, Other

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Audit event operation name as it appears in the record, usually includes both resource type and operation

columns.name: ResourceId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the cloud resource accessed

columns.name: IPAddress
columns.description: The client IP address used to access the cloud resource or control plane

columns.name: IsAnonymousProxy
columns.description: Indicates whether the IP address belongs to a known anonymous proxy (1) or no (0)

columns.name: CountryCode
columns.description: Two-letter code indicating the country where the client IP address is geolocated

columns.name: City
columns.description: City where the client IP address is geolocated

columns.name: Isp
columns.description: Internet service provider (ISP) associated with the IP address

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: User agent information from the web browser or other client application

columns.name: RawEventData
columns.description: Full raw event information from the data source in JSON format

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information about the audit event
